key_risks: Cybersecurity vulnerabilities, including ransomware incidents and global outages
Supply chain dependencies and potential disruptions
Regulatory and compliance challenges in a highly regulated environment
Labor disputes and workforce reductions impacting morale and stability
Activist investor pressure leading to strategic uncertainty
controversies: Ransomware incident in April 2023 causing data center outages
Global outage in July 2023 due to a CrowdStrike virus definition update
Unfair labor practice allegations filed with the National Labor Relations Board in December 2024
Layoffs and workforce reductions across several units
environmental_issues: Energy-efficient hardware and recycling initiatives as part of sustainability programs
social_issues: Unfair labor practice allegations and workforce reductions
Employee morale and organizational stability concerns
governance_issues: Activist investor pressure from Engaged Capital
Regulatory compliance challenges and potential legal liabilities

sources.title: NCR Reports Cybersecurity Incident | NCR | News | NCR Voyix
sources.snippet: NCR Reports Cybersecurity Incident. ATLANTA - April 17, 2023 - On April 13, NCR determined that a single data center outage that is impacting some functionality for a subset of its commerce customers was caused by a cyber ransomware incident. sources.title: NCR Voyix terminates staff across several units - The BayPay Forum
sources.snippet: The tech firm has gone through several major restructurings since the turn of the millennium. It eliminated over 1,000 jobs in 2018, cut around 600 roles in 2009 and laid off 1,500 employees in 2002. Atlanta-based NCR has become a prominent provider of self-checkout kiosks, point-of-sale systems, e-commerce platforms and loyalty programs.
